intro: Laser rechingeri, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant has a bulbous root system that stores water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Its leaves are narrow and strap-like, reducing water loss through transpiration. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, with six petals and a prominent central stamen.
